#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Green Party candidate Russell Korus , Vaughan
#Text=Sunday , October 7 , 2007
#Text=Russell Korus is running for the Green Party of Ontario in the Ontario provincial election , in the Vaughan riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=I came to politics at age 30 , with the birth of my first son .

#Text=Prior to that I was never even remotely interested in politics or government , but when I became a father I began thinking of what my son 's quality of life will be like when he is my age in 30 years time , and three realizations hit home very quickly .

#Text=First , that we are literally destroying the life support systems on Earth that sustain human life ; second that government , by virtue of developing public policy , is the most effective avenue of change ; and third , that the Green Party is the only party that is actually committed to change and is taking this issue seriously .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=This is my third campaign representing the Green Party , having run federally in 2006 and 2004 .
#Text=I graduated from Queen 's University in 1994 with a degree in philosophy , and am currently studying law while working in the IT industry .
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ? Why ?
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
#Text=The reality is that in Vaughan , Greg Sorbara , being a Liberal , cannot lose .
#Text=The riding has gone Liberal , by a wide margin , both federally and provincially , since time began .
#Text=So this is more about raising awareness of issues and more specifically campaigning for MMP .
#Text=[ ed : Note that the Liberals did n't hold the riding from 22 May 1979-21 November 1988 , as it was held twice by a Conservative , then once by an independent . ]
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=The three most important issues I feel are the environment , health care and of course the referendum on electoral reform .
#Text=The Green Party has the most sustainable policies and is actively advocating for MMP .
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=Introduce a true Accountability Act , something with teeth , so that politicians understand that there are real consequences to breaking the public trust or defrauding taxpayers .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?
#Text=The current form of property tax is a combined tax on land and buildings - in urban areas , mostly on buildings .
#Text=That causes a problem in that when you improve your property , your tax cost goes up , which discourages investment .
#Text=Shifting to a land-only tax would solve this .
#Text=There would no longer be any disincentive to improve your property , as your tax would be based solely on the land value .
#Text=( Of course , as building tax is reduced , land tax is increased to keep pace ) .
#Text=Most cities have lots of un- or under-utilized land in their downtown cores which is currently paying very little tax .

#Text=By taxing this vacant land at the full rate , cities would be able to increase revenues without raising overall tax rates - and owners would have a strong reason to either develop or sell to someone who would .
#Text=This push for downtown , brownfield development would reduce pressures for sprawl and greenfield development , which would help keep municipal costs down ( sprawl is expensive to service ) .
#Text=Our position is not to raise or lower the property tax rate , but to transform how it is calculated to use market forces to improve our cities - make them more compact , walkable , and green .
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?
#Text=By shifting investment to a green economy we could create thousands and thousands of green jobs .

#Text=The next major economic revolution , which is still in its infancy , and which is following the IT revolution , is the Green revolution , and if government would promote green research and development , then the next wave of economic power could come from Ontario .
#Text=What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ?
#Text=This election is the most important election of our lifetime because of the chance to implement MMP .
#Text=If MMP passes , we would finally be able to correct many of the democratic deficits that we face today .
#Text=For example , under MMP every vote will count .
#Text=Seems simple enough , until you realize that under our current system , unless you vote for the winner in your riding , your vote does n’t count at all .

#Text=MMP would also eliminate the artificial majorities that we are stuck with today , whereby a party that gets less than 40 % of the vote effectively has a stranglehold on power and is able to pass whatever legislation they want .
#Text=Common sense alone dictates that the percentage of votes that a party receives should be roughly equal to the percentage of seats that they get .
#Text=MMP may not be perfect , and I doubt that a perfect system even exists , but MMP is so much better then our current system , and for so many reasons .
#Text=I truly hope it passes .
#Text=What role , if any , does “ new media ” play in your campaign , and the campaign of your party ?
#Text=( websites , blogs , Facebook , YouTube videos , etc ) Do you view it as beneficial , or a challenge ?
#Text=I am on facebook , and my campaign website , www . pass-it-on . ca is essentially just a blog .
#Text=This is obviously critical to success , and I see the Internet in general as democracy ’s last hope , since all mainstream media is now completely corporate owned and controlled .
